originContent: Internet history forensics for Google Chrome/Chromium
translatedContent: Internet history forensics for Google Chrome/Chromium

originContent: Hindsight is a free tool for analyzing web artifacts. It started with the browsing history of the Google Chrome web browser and has expanded to support other Chromium-based applications (with more to come!). Hindsight can parse a number of different types of web artifacts, including URLs, download history, cache records, bookmarks, autofill records, saved passwords, preferences, browser extensions, HTTP cookies, and Local Storage records (HTML5 cookies). Once the data is extracted from each file, it is correlated with data from other history files and placed in a timeline.
translatedContent: Hindsight is a free tool for analyzing web artifacts. It began with the browsing history of the Google Chrome web browser and has expanded to support other Chromium-based applications (with more to come!). Hindsight can parse various types of web artifacts, including URLs, download history, cache records, bookmarks, autofill records, saved passwords, preferences, browser extensions, HTTP cookies, and Local Storage records (HTML5 cookies). Once data is extracted from each file, it is correlated with data from other history files and placed in a timeline.

originContent: It has a simple web UI - to start it, run "hindsight_gui.py" (or on Windows, the packaged "hindsight_gui.exe") and visit http://localhost:8080 in a browser:
translatedContent: It has a simple web UI - to start it, run "hindsight_gui.py" (or on Windows, the packaged "hindsight_gui.exe") and visit http://localhost:8080 in a browser:

originContent: The only field you are required to complete is "Profile Path". This is the location of the Chrome profile you want to analyze (the default profile paths for different OSes is listed at the bottom of this page). Click "Run" and you'll be taken to the results page in where you can save the results to a spreadsheet (or other formats).
translatedContent: The only field you must fill in is "Profile Path". This is the location of the Chrome profile you want to analyze (the default profile paths for different OSes are listed at the bottom of this page). Click "Run" and you will be taken to the results page where you can save the results to a spreadsheet (or other formats).

translatedContent: There also is command line version of Hindsight - hindsight.py or hindsight.exe. The user guide in the documentation folder covers many topics, but the info below should get you started with the command line version:

originContent: There also is command line version of Hindsight - hindsight.py or hindsight.exe. The user guide in the documentation folder covers many topics, but the info below should get you started with the command line version:

translatedContent: | -i or --input  | Path to the Chrome(ium) "Default" directory |

originContent: | -i or --input  | Path to the Chrome(ium) "Default" directory |
translatedContent: | -o or --output | Name of the output file (without extension) |

originContent: | -o or --output | Name of the output file (without extension) |
translatedContent: | -f or --format | Output format (default is XLSX, other options are SQLite and JSONL) |

originContent: | -f or --format | Output format (default is XLSX, other options are SQLite and JSONL) |
translatedContent: | -c or --cache  | Path to the cache directory; only needed if the directory is outside the given "input" directory. Mac systems are setup this way by default. |

originContent: | -c or --cache  | Path to the cache directory; only needed if the directory is outside the given "input" directory. Mac systems are setup this way by default. |
translatedContent: | -b or --browser_type | The type of browser the input files belong to. Supported options are Chrome (default) and Brave.

originContent: | -b or --browser_type | The type of browser the input files belong to. Supported options are Chrome (default) and Brave.
translatedContent: | -l or --log	 | Location Hindsight should log to (will append if exists) |

originContent: | -l or --log	 | Location Hindsight should log to (will append if exists) |
translatedContent: | -h or --help   | Shows these options and the default Chrome data locations |

originContent: | -h or --help   | Shows these options and the default Chrome data locations |
translatedContent: | -t or --timezone | Display timezone for the timestamps in XLSX output |

originContent: | -t or --timezone | Display timezone for the timestamps in XLSX output |
